alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 19 at 7:48PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of eastern, north central, northeast, northwest, and south central Nevada, including the following areas, in eastern Nevada, White Pine County. In north central Nevada, Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County and Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County. In northeast Nevada, Northern Elko County, Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range, South Central Elko County, Southeastern Elko County and Southwest Elko County. In northwest Nevada, Humboldt County. In south central Nevada, Northeastern Nye County and Northwestern Nye County. * Areas that could see significant flooding and impacts from this system are southern Lander and Eureka Counties, White Pine, and Northern Nye counties. * WHEN...From 11 PM PDT this evening through late Monday night. * Moderate to heavy rain starting along and south of Highway 50 overnight. * Moderate to heavy rain reaching up to at least Interstate 80 during the day on Sunday * Potential for moderate to heavy rain covering most of northeast and central NV by Monday * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage, roadways, culverts, and urban areas. Locations with know low-water crossings will likely be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - - Deep Tropical moisture is forecast to move northward into portions of northern Nye County, Southern Lander and Eureka Counties, White Pine counties and southern Elko County mainly affecting the Ruby Mountains starting late on Saturday lasting at least through Monday morning. The moisture, atmospheric instability, and weak lift associated with the decaying remnants of Hilary will aid in the potential for moderate to heavy rainfall and the potential of localized heavy rainfall from thunderstorms that could lead to flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
